constraint - constraint.

convertAndValidate

public static void convertAndValidate(FormWidget form)
                               throws ValidationFailureException
Converts and validates the form data. It is similar to GenericFormElement.convertAndValidate() except that it also throws an exception when there are validation errors.

Parameters:
form - The form to convert and validate.
Throws:
ValidationFailureException - It is thrown when there are validation errors after validating.
Since:
1.1.4

addDateRangeElements

public static void addDateRangeElements(FormWidget form,
                                        String prefix,
                                        String startSuffix,
                                        String endSuffix,
                                        String label,
                                        boolean allowEquals)
Adds date range elements to given form. A constraint will be associated with the range end element making sure that the end value is not less than the range start value. Both elements will be non-mandatory.

Parameters:
form - Form where range elements will be added.
prefix - The common ID prefix for range elements.
startSuffix - ID suffix for the range start element.
endSuffix - ID suffix for the range end element.
label - Common label for range elements.
allowEquals - Whether equal dates are allowed.
Since:
2.0

addTimeRangeElements

public static void addTimeRangeElements(FormWidget form,
                                        String prefix,
                                        String startSuffix,
                                        String endSuffix,
                                        String label,
                                        boolean allowEquals)
Adds time range elements to given form. A constraint will be associated with the range end element making sure that the end value is not less than the range start value. Both elements will be non-mandatory.

Parameters:
form - Form where range elements will be added.
prefix - The common ID prefix for range elements.
startSuffix - ID suffix for the range start element.
endSuffix - ID suffix for the range end element.
label - Common label for range elements.
allowEquals - Whether equal times are allowed.
Since:
2.0
